p: The compositional analysis of the synthesized nanoparticles was performed using Energy-dispersive X-ray spectroscopy. EDX spectra results showed that the nanoparticles were mainly composed of chromium (63.76%) and oxygen (32.15%), as shown in Figure 3e [ 2]. One extra peak associated with carbon (4.09%) is also evident in the EDX spectrum. The carbon peak could be attributed to the presence of phytomolecules (polyphenols, alkaloids, flavonoids, etc.) of leaf extract of A. indicum (L.) Sweet adsorbed on Cr 2O 3 nanoparticleâ€™s surface [ 9, 10].
